nodes.text: So what's new with you?
I'm making plans to explore Caligari over the midterm break. I've never been to the town itself.
Caligari isn't that interesting a place. I've lived there all my life.
Do you know where the Paladin Memorial is?
There's a Paladin Memorial in Caligari? Sorry, I've never even heard of it.
I'll have to ask Lady Moira about it. I've heard that it is impressive.
So why are you so fascinated with Paladins? They aren't the only heroes in the world, you know. Rogues can be heroes, too, or so they tell us.
My father devoted his life to being a Paladin. He was always off doing great deeds. When he did come home, he would tell me about his adventures. He wanted me to grow up to be like him.
I know he'd be disappointed in me for becoming a Rogue instead of a Paladin.
I'm sure your father would be very proud of you for coming to this school and working to become a hero.
<shrug>
Paladins are supposed to be wise and compassionate, right? He'd understand why you are a Rogue as long as you do good things with what you got.
What about your father? Would he understand that you are a Rogue?
My father's been dead so long that I don't really remember him. I don't know what his opinion would be.
Do you know what your father will say about you becoming a Rogue? Nothing. He's dead. His opinion doesn't matter now.
Get over your father and live your own life.
So what do you think is going to be on the Midterm test?
Everything! I'm studying all my notes from the first day of class onward. I'm sure it will cover all the Ways - Küchenschabe, Godot, Fledermaus...
The only thing I'm sure about the test is that it will be difficult.
Would you like to help me study for the test?
We can do that now, if you like.
... And that's why it is called "Way of the Fledermaus."
Thank you for taking the time to help me with my studies. You are much easier to understand than the Master. You should be the one teaching the class.
Ah! I'm glad you explained it. I'd probably get it wrong on the test. I keep thinking that the 'Way of the Bat' is to wander aimlessly in the dark rather than to listen for things.
So 'a bat may be blind, but he's the listening kind' will be my way of remembering the lesson from now on.
You study like your life depended upon it. It's not like a bad grade will kill you. In life, it's not what you know - it's what you do that counts.
Mind if I borrow your class notes to study for the test?
Isn't that cheating?
Cheating's not a problem for the Rogue class - it's getting caught at cheating that's the problem. So no, there's nothing wrong with me using your notes to study.
Oh... right.
Here are my notes. As you can see, I wrote them in Germanish. It seemed appropriate for writing down what the Master says.
You know how to write in Germanish? That's impressive. I don't how to read Germanish, but thanks for the offer, anyway.
You know, you really don't have to study this hard for the test. It's really more a matter of figuring things out rather than repeating what the Master says.
So are there any good books I should read?
I think you are better off reading your class notes and studying for the midterm than reading other books.
With your brains, you'll have no trouble with the Midterm. You're the smartest person in class.
I'm not really that smart - I have to study in order to learn things.
That just proves how smart you are - you go out of your way to learn. Most people don't bother.
You look great today. You always look so dapper and neat. You and Joel earn the best dressed award every day.
Really? I am just wearing the school uniform. I don't intend to call attention to myself.
You have so much style - you can wear anything with pizzazz.
You know, we could go back to your room and look things over... our class notes, that is.
Oh no... my room is a total mess right now. There's no place to sit.
Well, if there's no room to sit, we can always lie down on your bed...
<blush> Um... maybe another time when my room is cleaner...
See you tomorrow.
Good night, Shawn.
